review: Bought this for the purpose of streaming our high school sports events to our TV when we are unable to go to the games.  I send the streaming video to the Chromecast from my desktop PC using the Chrome browser.  My desktop is wired to the router with gigabit speeds.  The first away football game my PC kept crashing and the video stuttered quite a bit.  I recently had to change my router and now it doesn't stutter and the computer doesn't crash.  For this purpose I am quite happy with my $35 purpose.I have tested out the other features and if it didn't work for my previously stated needs I would return it.  I don't like that nothing is really installed on the device and I need to use my Android tablet to make it work.  It is just kind of clunky.  Half the time I used Netflix I couldn't pause or even stop the video.  I had to unplug the power in order to get it to stop.  On top of it all I can't believe that even the Google Slides app doesn't cast to the Chromecast for giving presentations.  Seriously.If you are considering this device for watching Netflix get a Roku stick or if you want the fancy remote with a headphone jack get the Roku 3.  For watching Netflix, Hulu, or other streaming channels you are much better off with a Roku.  The Roku stick is definitely worth the extra $15.
